translated: Points of Controversy
The Fifty on Latent Tendencies🔽13. The Section on Lasting an Aeon
Lasting an Aeon
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Kappo ca saṇṭhāti buddho ca loke uppajjatīti?
analyzed: kappaḥ ca saṇṭhāti buddhaḥ ca loke uppajjati iti
translated: “Does an aeon end and a Buddha arise in the world?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Kappo ca saṇṭhāti saṅgho ca bhijjatīti?
analyzed: kappaḥ ca saṇṭhāti saṅghaḥ ca bhijjati iti
translated: “Does an aeon end and the Saṅgha split?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Kappo ca saṇṭhāti kappaṭṭho ca kappaṭṭhiyaṁ kammaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: kappaḥ ca saṇṭhāti kappaṭṭho ca kappaṭṭhiyam kammam karoti iti
translated: “Does an aeon end and one lasting an aeon perform an action that lasts an aeon?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Kappo ca saṇṭhāti kappaṭṭho ca puggalo kālaṁ karotīti?
analyzed: kappaḥ ca saṇṭhāti kappaṭṭhaḥ ca puggalo kālam karoti iti
translated: “Does an aeon end and one lasting an aeon die?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Atītaṁ kappaṁ tiṭṭheyya, anāgataṁ kappaṁ tiṭṭheyyāti?
analyzed: atītam kappam tiṭṭheyya anāgatam kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Would one last for an aeon in the past and in the future?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is one lasting an aeon one who will last for an aeon?”
“Yes.”

original: Dve kappe tiṭṭheyya … tayo kappe tiṭṭheyya … cattāro kappe tiṭṭheyyāti?
analyzed: dve kappe tiṭṭheyya tayo kappe tiṭṭheyya  cattāro kappe tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: Would he last for two eons? … three eons? … four eons?”
“No, friend.”
“Would he last for an eon?”
“Yes, friend.”

analyzed: kappaṭṭhaḥ kappe ḍayhante kattha gacchati iti
translated: “When an eon is burning up, where does one who lasts for an eon go?”
“He goes to another world system.”
“Does he go after death? Does he go by flying through the air?”
“He goes after death.”
“Does the action that lasts for an eon have a further ripening or not?”
“No, friend.”
“Does he go by flying through the air?”
“Yes, friend.”
“Is one who lasts for an eon a person of supernormal power?”
“No, friend.”
“Is one who lasts for an eon a person of supernormal power?”
“Yes, friend.”

original: Kappaṭṭhena chandiddhipādo bhāvito vīriyiddhipādo bhāvito cittiddhipādo bhāvito vīmaṁsiddhipādo bhāvitoti?
analyzed: kappaṭṭhena chandiddhipādaḥ bhāvitaḥ vīriyiddhipādaḥ bhāvitaḥ cittiddhipādaḥ bhāvitaḥ vīmasiddhipādaḥ bhāvitaḥ iti
translated: “Has one who lasts for an eon developed the basis for spiritual power that possesses concentration due to desire and volitional formations of striving?”
“No, friend.”

original: Na vattabbaṁ—🔽“kappaṭṭho kappaṁ tiṭṭheyyā”ti?🔽Āmantā.🔽Nanu vuttaṁ bhagavatā—🔽“Āpāyiko nerayiko,
analyzed: na vattabba  kappa ṭṭhaḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati  āmantā  nanu vuttam bhagavatā  āpāyikaḥ nerayikaḥ
translated: “Is it not said:🔽‘One who causes a schism in the Sangha
is bound for the Downfall, bound for hell,🔽to last for an eon, incurable.
One who delights in quarrels, who is intent on unrighteousness,
breaks up the harmony of the Saṅgha.
Having broken up the harmony of the Saṅgha,
he cooks in hell for an eon.”
Is there a sutta?
“Yes.”

analyzed: tena hi kappa ṭṭhaḥ kappam tiṭṭheyya ati
translated: “Then he would stand for an eon.”
The Discussion of Standing for an Eon is finished.
